title: Recall of CORE Powerfoods frozen meals extended after salmonella outbreak
text:
Fifteen people from across Australia have been struck down by salmonella after eating Core Powerfoods frozen meals. The outbreak is linked to eight products from the range sold at Coles and IGA supermarkets with use-by dates between August 26 and October 4, 2020. Health authorities urged anyone who consumed the products and was suffering with symptoms of gastro to seek medical attention.

A recall of frozen microwave meals by CORE Powerfoods has been extended, with 11 cases of salmonella linked to the product.

SA Health yesterday issued an urgent alert for meals with a best before date from March 5, 2020, to October 4, 2020, to be returned to the place of purchase, or disposed of.

Eleven South Australians have been struck down with salmonella, after eating the frozen meals and three people have been hospitalised.

The number of salmonella cases has jumped from three last week.

Corey Monaghan, 23, was hospitalised with salmonella last week and suffered stomach cramps, initially thinking he had gastro.

CORE Powerfoods are based in Victoria and the company is working with the Health Department to identify the likely cause of the outbreak.

Salmonellosis symptoms include fever, headache, diarrhoea, abdominal pain, nausea and vomiting.
